content: mistake rib scarf this easy-to-knit scarf is worked by repeating just one row a simple knit 2 purl 2 row © joan janes 2011-2019 joaninglisjanes@gmail com skills used cast on knit purl cast off pattern instructions cast on 31 sts or a multiple of 4 minus 1 size 76 inches by 5 inches wide unstretched row 1 *k2 p2* to last 3 sts end k2 p1 repeat row 1 until scarf is desired length materials and equipment 5 mm needles cast off in pattern by knitting the knits and 300 m 150 grams of noro silk garden or purling the purls while casting off another worsted weight yarn weave in ends gauge 20 sts over 4 inches in stocking stitch blocking when scarf is complete soak in warm water and abbreviations * * repeat instructions between asterisks eucalan for 20 to 30 minutes k knit squeeze out excess moisture in a towel p purl lay flat to dry adjusting scarf to desired shape st s stitches do not hang to dry st st stocking stitch stockinette knits appear on one side and purls appear on other side other yarn options - for a similar size scarf in a thinner dk or double knitting weight yarn 22 sts over 4 inches in st st cast on 35 sts and try a 4 5 mm needle you will need more yarn approximately 330 to 350 m - for a similar size scarf in a thicker chunky weight yarn 16 sts over 4 inches in st st cast on 27 sts and try a 6 5 or 7 0 mm needle you will need less yarn approximately 250 m options for a wider scarf cast on a larger multiple of 4 stitches minus 1 for example  cast on 35 sts 36-1 or  cast on 39 sts 40-1 or  cast on 43 sts or 44-1 remember that increasing the width will mean increasing the yarn requirements too or having to knit a shorter scarf when planning the size of a scarf knitters typically make a narrow scarf in a longer length so that it can be wrapped around multiple times when knitting a wider scarf they will often make it shorter because extra wraps are unnecessary © joan janes 2011-2019 joaninglisjanes@gmail com
